basics.name: Raghu Hemadri
basics.label: ML Researcher
basics.summary: I am a Machine Learning Researcher with a focus on Natural Language Processing and Reinforcement Learning. I am currently pursuing my Master's in Computer Engineering at New York University. I have a strong background in Mathematics and Statistics. I am passionate about solving real-world problems using Machine Learning and Deep Learning.

work.name: Electrical and Computer Engineering Department, NYU Tandon School of Engineering
work.summary: AI for hardware design, LLM based frameworks
highlights: Conducting research on leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) for hardware Code analysis, including using LLMs as encoders to predict vulnerable code directly from RTL before synthesis.

work.name: Massachusetts Institute of Technology
work.summary: Multi-agent Reinforcement Learning, Policy Loss Function, Vision Language Models
highlights: Working on LLMs for multi-agent reinforcement learning (MARL), focusing on long-horizon planning and task execution in complex, partially observable environments. Formulated new policy loss function to improve multi-agent decision-making, reducing suboptimal actions by 26%
Developed Vision Language Models (VLMs) for MARL, enabling agents to understand and execute complex tasks using visual inputs and natural language instructions.

certificates.name: Algorithmic Trading & Quantitative Analysis Using Python

publications.name: Detecting anomalies in log messages using code-derived message patterns to guide structured message classification
publications.summary: Developed a log anomaly detection system leveraging code-derived message patterns for structured classification. The system processes 10TB of log data daily with 94% accuracy, reducing bug-fixing time from 2 days to 1 hour by enabling early and precise anomaly detection.

publications.name: Attendance Management System
publications.summary: We propose a novel method of marking attendance using facial recognition. The proposed method uses small and accurate deep supervised network for recognition of faces in a wild classroom scenario. The proposed method is robust to variations in illumination, pose, and expression.

publications.name: AEVBComm: an intelligent communication system based on beta-VAE
publications.summary: The paper proposes a new CNN based VAE communication system. The VAE (continuous latent space) based communication systems confer unprecedented improvement in the system performance compared to AE (distributed latent space) and other traditional methods.

publications.name: Jaya Algorithm Based Intelligent Color Reduction
publications.summary: A color reduction hybrid algorithm is proposed by applying Jaya algorithm for clustering. We examine the act of Jaya algorithm in the pre-clustering stage and K-means in the post-clustering phase.

publications.name: ChildrEN SafEty and Rescue (CENSER) System for Trafficked Children from Brothels in India
publications.summary: We propose the ChildrEN SafEty and Rescue (CENSER) system used by the Guria non-profit organization to retrieve trafficked children from brothels in India.

publications.name: Iteratively reweighted minimax-concave penalty minimization for accurate low-rank plus sparse matrix decomposition
publications.summary: We propose weighted minimax-concave penalty (WMCP) as the nonconvex regularizer and show that it admits an equivalent representation that enables weight adaptation. Similarly, an equivalent representation to the weighted matrix gamma norm (WMGN) enables weight adaptation for the low-rank part.

publications.name: Performance analysis of weighted low rank model with sparse image histograms for face recognition under lowlevel illumination and occlusion
publications.summary: A comparison of the low-rank recovery performance of two Low-rank matrix approximation (LRMA) algorithms-RPCA and WSNM is brought out on occluded human facial images.

publications.name: PrefixLLM: LLM-aided Prefix Circuit Design
publications.summary: PrefixLLM leverages large language models (LLMs) to synthesize optimized prefix circuits, transforming the task into a structured text generation problem (SPCR). Using an iterative design space exploration (DSE) framework, it achieves 3.70% area reduction while maintaining the same delay, demonstrating the potential of LLMs in arithmetic circuit synthesis.
